news.title: Michael and Susan Dell to donate $6.25 billion to fund 'Trump accounts' for 25 million U.S. kids
news.summary: Dell CEO says he first heard of the idea of seeding accounts from hedge fund manager Brad Gerstner. Dell is a Dell Technologies, a subsidiary of Dell Inc.

news.title: YouTube's new AI deepfake tracking tool is alarming experts and creators
news.summary: A YouTube tool that uses creators' biometrics to remove AI-generated videos also allows Google to train its AI models on that sensitive data.

news.title: Costco sues Trump admin seeking tariff refunds before Supreme Court rules if they're illegal
news.summary: Costco joined dozens of other companies that are seeking to protect their rights to refunds of Trump's tariffs without first waiting for the Supreme Court.

news.title: SoftBank’s Son ‘was crying’ about the firm's need to sell its Nvidia stake
news.summary: SoftBank Group founder Masayoshi Son has downplayed his firm's decision to dump its Nvidia position. Son said he "was crying" to sell the shares.

news.title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk bats for H-1B visas, says tariffs distort markets
news.summary: Tesla CEO raises concerns over Trump's tariff policy. Tesla CEO says he does not support closing of the H-1B visa program. Tesla is a major employer of foreign workers.

news.title: Gold at $10,000, a quantum-driven crypto collapse and costly AI scandals are among these ‘outrageous’ bets for 2026.
news.summary: Saxo Bank is at it again with outrageous predictions for 2026. Saxo Bank predicts that the U.S. economy will grow at a rate of 1.5 per cent a year for the next five years.

news.title: If you’re this type of investor, get out of the stock market — now
news.summary: The economy and the stock market are at a breaking point. Here’s what to do, depending on your age. What do you think? Share your thoughts in the comments below.

news.title: Goodbye, bull market: This spot-on indicator is saying what you don’t want to hear
news.summary: Market timers have reached a point of extreme exuberance. That’s bearish for stocks and gold. The market is in a bearish mood, which is bad for gold and stocks.

news.title: ‘It’s expensive feeding and housing a family of 7’: I’m 41 with $46K in credit-card debt. Do I raid my $1.2 million IRAs?
news.summary: “I bring in $7,200 a month from my pension and disability benefits,” he says. “I’m very lucky. I’ve been through a lot.”

news.title: Bitcoin still has one thing going for it that investors are missing
news.summary: Governments increasingly are using cryptocurrency to gain geopolitical power and independence from the dollar. Governments increasingly are use cryptocurrency to gains geopolitical power, independence from dollar.
